author: Earl Lofton
comment: The application worked well mainly. When connected to a leg press machine the weight option for my workout input started at 1to999 and only scrolled by 1 pound. So to get to my 205 weight i used it would've taken forever to get to 205. I saw on another machine it went by 25 increments. Just small bugs but overall helpful and organized. I would like to see a trainers version to track workouts with clients especially when they have cardio to do on off days.

author: Angie T
comment: I was excited to have this app for help in tracking my workouts with using a pen and paper log. While it recognizes some qrc codes I have to manually enter the data. The majority of the time when I scan the codes,  I receive a message stating the code is invalid. Help please! Thank you!

author: Aaron Smith
comment: This app has a ton of potential. I really want to use it and stick to it but I am finding a few issues. It would be great to be able to enter pounds or kilograms because the equipment is in kg and the freeweights are in lbs. The app has been crashing a ton for me lately since the most recent update whenever doing a save of a manual log.   One of my biggest problems is it isn't intuitive, its actually confusing to use unless you want to put time into figuring it out, this may sway other users from ever even touching the app.  The app has a ton going for, and I really want to get behind it, but it needs polish.

author: Nacho Fnub
comment: Each time I had this app connected to a machine that I was working out on, it would only record 25% of the calories burned. And that is every single time. And if I wanted to try at the end of the workout to scan my workout it just simply won't scan the HUGE scannable icon. I do not recommend this app. It's beyond frustrating. I gave it 2 stars because the idea is good however the functionality is horrible.

author: Richard Johnson
comment: One thing bugs me, when I use the qf code to do some weights I have to activate location, if I forget to deactivate it it'll run my battery flat and I really don't know why it wants my location anyway.  Other than that I love this little app mainly because it sticks to doing just what it needs to and does it well  Following the latest update not only does it mandate having location services but now wants access to camera, funnily enough I don't want to take pictures when I am in the gym. Plus several times after a treadmill workout it has failed to appear on my account so it looks like quality is going downhill

author: Chad Kilgore
comment: Clumsy interface, not intuitive. Won't connect via Bluetooth with treadmill; errors that it's not on internet. Spent more time in app than working out.

author: Chris Crans
comment: Just bought a new Lifefitness F3 treadmill with Trackconnect console, and I thought this app was supposed to sync workouts to my phone via Bluetooth automatically. I have to manually enter everything? What's the point of this app? My Samsung galaxy S8+ pairs with the treadmill, and the Bluetooth icon appears on the track-connect console..... Am I missing something? I will raise my review rating if this can be resolved.

author: Angie Lanigan
comment: Impossible to move to a new exercise. Having a video is nice, but the tracking features are not helpful. Spent more time at the gym trying to figure out how to enter data than I did getting work done.

author: Christopher Hopkins
comment: Generally works ok and very handy to avoid manually recording your workouts. When you link it to samsung s health it records elliptical training as hiking. Froze up once when showing live results from a machine and then the result wasn't saved
Go to all bh live gyms connects but doesn't log work outs. Doesn't scan and Bluetooth connects but no log either. Rubbish app

author: cristobal colon
comment: tried tbis app several times over last year and 90% of the time crashed in the middle of workout. tried uninstalling and restalling and still same, not reliable do not recommend.

author: Kevin Dudley
comment: Doesn't connect reliably, login via QR code says it's logged in, then get a message saying logged in via the internet (even when connected via USB cable). Manual logging of workout is clunky compared to other apps. Although cardio does sometimes record I've not been able to get any weight machine to record. Am now going to uninstall!!!
Needs to be able to log the info automatically each rep by scanning at start then scanning at end  when using machines or why bother making this product. Maybe I'm missing something

author: debs Sal
comment: This worked great until the recent update.  Now every time I try to add a manual log entry the app crashes.  Please fix 😐

author: Matt Canova
comment: Absolutely garbage since the last update.NOTHING works properly, especially the calorie counter. FIX THIS it was perfect before you up and ruined it with the last update.

author: Hannah Andrew
comment: The icon which comes up on the homepage of my weekly calorie goal doesn't disappear when I open different sections. It's just over the top of everything I try to do, and it makes it utterly unusable.

author: Maggie Vasquez
comment: Was super excited to use this app as to I have a membership with planet fitness and it keeps saying invalid code, hoping it'll get fixed ASAP. Will leave a better review when fixed.

author: Jason Paine
comment: Good little app however sometimes doesn't sync up a workout you have just done so have to enter it manually

author: John Begnaud
comment: This connects to the machined at my gym. It let's me set up custom workouts and get started immediately. It helps coordinate and track all my workouts!

author: Tino Garcia
comment: Can't complete the connection to MyFitnessPal. Get a white blank screen after I login to MFP. Lost previous days workout stats. Fix the bugs it has a lot of potential

author: CincyNeid
comment: 1) Caloric burn is way off. 2) app states it pushes data to MyFitnessPal, which is doesn't. Not sure why. I've tried it 2 separate times and it will not push strength or cardio training to MFP.

author: K Kelly
comment: Great idea but dont work at all , the  scan  does not work , u enter manually it it wont go to next screen  .  Wish it would work properly

author: Dennis Mayer
comment: Does not recognize any Life Fitness equipment, tried it on 4 different machines, all 4 unrecognizable bar codes. Will delete this app.

author: Kev Palmer
comment: B4 update. The app use to sync with samsung health, duznt work now though, even though both are linked together

author: Ross Williams
comment: Password reset function doesn't work.  It sends an email with a link to the login screen. Trying to log in using FB doesn't work as it says user already exists. ????

author: Jason Zaring
comment: Can't get it connected with MyFitnessPal.  When I try I just get a white screen.  Also send feedback crashes the app

author: Gregory Rogers
comment: I entered a few manual workouts. Now I can't find them and it says I haven't burned any calories

author: Clau God-Cort
comment: Everytime I wanted to scan to login at the gym says that it is an invalid lf code

author: Dina Mencarini
comment: It is routinely not saving my workouts. I'm going to abandon it and try another app

author: Matthew Jordan
comment: The app is just meh. It's nice that it pulls the data off the treadmill but it's just weird to use.

author: joel andrepont
comment: Continuously crashes. Loses connection with training equipment.

author: Chuck Ferring
comment: Freezes constantly, utterly useless until they fix the hanging issues

author: Sheila Foreman
comment: I have had to go back to paper and pencil because I couldn't sign in at the gym and even the machines that should have logged me in via the phone didn't.

author: kamal desai
comment: Very buggy. Phone slows down and hangs up

author: Michelle Godwin
comment: I haven't quite figured the app out yet
Love it keeps me motivated and so easy to just see how many calories I'm actually burning in the week.

author: Kevin Machnik
comment: Can't find my saved workouts on the machine anymore after logging in, which was the only point of this app for me.

author: corey rosenburg
comment: Was working great but latest update has it logging me out every day again. Please fix!

reply.author: Life Fitness
reply.content:
Hi Corey,

Sorry to hear about your issue.  We've released a new version of the app.  Can you let me know if you are having the same issue?  developers@lifefitness.com 

Thanks!

comment: Great but tumbler no.s a bit small. Now wearing glasses at gym

author: Melissa K
comment: Downloaded yesterday, scanned codes, saved the information, received saved confirmations..all logs are blank, nothing saved. Galaxy S8+
